p: The ACTT study, organized by the US National Institute of Allergic and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) was a phase III, randomized, placebo-controlled trial with 1,063 patients included. Results of the study found that patients treated with remdesivir showed a clinical improvement after a 31% shorter period. The study group had a median recovery time of 11 days, compared to 15 days in the control group. The study group had a mortality of 8% compared to 11.6% in the control group ( 52).
